snippet: President Bashar al-Assad’s public activities mask increasing aggression in battle and belie fears among many supporters of an American attack.
abstract: Syrian Pres Bashar al-Assad’s public activities mask increasing aggression in battle and belie fears among many of his supporters that an American attack is imminent; for two and a half years, Assad has never wavered from his position that the uprising is a foreign plot, and he continues to refuse to express any responsibility or remorse for the country's bloody turmoil, which he steadfastly refuses to call a civil war.

byline.original: By NEIL MacFARQUHAR and BEN HUBBARD
byline.contributor: Neil MacFarquhar reported from New York, and Ben Hubbard from Beirut, Lebanon. Hwaida Saad contributed reporting from Beirut, and Hala Droubi from Dubai, United Arab Emirates.
